data.title: Dan L. Boho
data.meta_description: Dan L. Boho has a trial and mediation practice with verdicts and appearances as pro hac vice counsel across the United States. He handles high-profile, media-intensive matters.
data.text:
Dan Boho has a national trial and mediation practice with verdicts in Illinois, California, Florida, New York, New Jersey, and Pennsylvania. He handles high-profile, media-intensive matters defending clients ranging from Fortune 50 corporations to mid- and small-sized companies in personal injury, product liability, and commercial litigation matters.

Dan is a Fellow and former State Chair of the prestigious American College of Trial Lawyers, a Fellow of the International Academy of Trial Lawyers (600 top trial lawyers from the U.S. and 30 other countries), and a member of the American Board of Trial Advocates (ABOTA).

Crain's Chicago Business featured Dan as one of six lawyers honored as Chicago's best lawyers in its "Chicago's Best, On the Record." Leading Lawyers Magazine, in a survey of Illinois lawyers, recognized Dan as one of the top two personal injury defense lawyers in the state of Illinois. Illinois Super Lawyers also recognizes Dan as one of the Top 100 Lawyers in the State of Illinois, 2024.

He is listed among Best Lawyers in America in Commercial Litigation and Product Liability and served as Chairman of the Commercial Litigation Section of the Federation of Defense and Corporate Counsel.

Dan has served as General Counsel, board member, and secretary of the 22,000-member Chicago Bar Association. He was named a 2023 Justice John Paul Stevens Award Recipient by the Chicago Bar Association and the Chicago Bar Foundation. Dan served as Vice Chair and General Counsel of the Chicagoland Chamber of Commerce and was the first annual award winner of the Gerald J. Roper Award for Excellence.

Dan joined Hinshaw in 1977. He was a member of Hinshaw's Executive Committee for more than 30 years and was a former co-leader of the firm's national Defense Litigation Practice Group.
